-1.title: Episode dated 4 May 2016
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Catering on the Side
1.plot: The Groves Bar & Grill in Gilbert, Arizona.

3.title: Big Earl's Gone Wild
3.plot: After losing thousands of dollars in unaccounted alcohol and hearing rumors of late-night staff parties, the owner of Big Earl's Greasy Eats contacts Charles Stiles and the Mystery Diners for help. Mystery Diners Shellene and Chris go undercover as a waitress and flirty customer in hopes of scoring invitations to an after-hours bash.

4.title: F for Effort
4.plot: Employees here threaten patrons, drink on the job and eat customers' food.

5.title: Managing Disaster
5.plot: The manager of Amaro Italian Bistro is acting inappropriately with staff.

6.title: Grumpy Tom
6.plot: Charles Stiles and the Mystery Diners descend upon The Blue Moose, where longtime chef "Grumpy Tom" has a knack for disrespecting everyone in the place, including the newly installed second-generation owner.

7.title: Raiding the Bar
7.plot: A pub owner in Los Angeles suspects that one of her bartenders might be overpouring for customers, giving away too many free drinks and overtipping himself.

8.title: Undercover Brother
8.plot: Mystery Diners goes undercover to see whether this brother is a keeper.

1.title: The Tipping Point
1.plot: Mystery Diners goes in to see what a D'Cache waiter has up his sleeve.

2.title: Something Smells Fishy
2.plot: La Traviata Restaurant in Long Beach, CA.

3.title: Getting a Leg Up
3.plot: Pips on La Brea in Los Angeles, California.

4.title: Raising the Stakes
4.plot: The manager of "Marrakesh Restaurant", a Moroccan-theme restaurant in Studio City, California, is suspected of having a gambling problem that's affecting his job performance.

5.title: Extra Curricular
5.plot: The owner of "Pina Pizza House", a pizza parlor in Downey, California, is concerned that one of his waiters is hanging out with his college buddies when he should be working.

6.title: Valet Disservice
6.plot: Ca' Brea employs Mystery Diners to drive out bad valet service.

7.title: Sleeping on the Job
7.plot: Noticing contrasts in inventory, Parma's owner contacts Charles Stiles.

8.title: Singles Night
8.plot: Charles Stiles investigates a drop in female patrons at Whiskey Dick's.

9.title: Sour Grapes
9.plot: Mystery Diners check out Rhythm Kitchen to see why spirit sales are down.

11.title: Love Hurts
11.plot: The owners of "Marché Bacchus", a French bistro in Las Vegas, suffer financially as a result of a bad breakup involving 2 members of their staff, prompting them to call Charles and his undercover team for help turning the situation around.

12.title: My Brother's Keeper
12.plot: Complaints about Capo's manager (brother of owner) have come to Nico, the owner.

13.title: Where's the Beef?
13.plot: Meat sales don't add up to inventory at Via Brasil Steakhouse.

1.title: Dining in the Dark
1.plot: In the third-season opener, a monthly dining-in-the-dark event at "Catharsis Restaurant and Lounge" in Miami is observed by Charles, after the owner receives complaints about theft and inappropriate touching.

2.title: Cheese-Burglar
2.plot: The owners of "Cheeseburger Baby", in Miami Beach, Florida, have suspicions about an ex-convict who is working for them when money appears to be missing from the cash register.

3.title: Party Monster
3.plot: Charles arrives at "George's Restaurant" on Sunset in Miami, Florida to help the namesake owner figure out why his earnings are down and it doesn't take long to determine that an "everyone have fun" policy is partially to blame.

4.title: Catch of the Day
4.plot: Charles and his crew arrive at "Garcia's Seafood Grille and Fish Market" in Miami, Florida to solve a mystery involving missing crab claws.

5.title: All in the Family
5.plot: Charles arrives at R&O's Restaurant in New Orleans, LA., at the request of the owner, who feels like he's being disrespected by his staff, many of whom are family members.

6.title: Friends with Benefits
6.plot: Husband-wife owners of "N'awlins Café" in New Orleans ask for help getting to the root of why their restaurant isn't thriving. Charles and his team discover that the manager has staffed the place with her friends, many not fully-qualified.

7.title: Barbecue Blues
7.plot: Cooper's Old Time Pit Bar-B-Que in Fort Worth, Texas.

8.title: No Laughing Matter
8.plot: Charles and his team arrive at "Deanie's Seafood" in New Orleans, where they are tasked with keeping an eye on the restaurant's manager, a wannabe comedian; at the same time, they discover another employee's behavior is no laughing matter.

9.title: Crazy Hearts
9.plot: The owner of "Poppy's the Crazy Lobster Bar and Grill", in New Orleans, LA., ask Charles to get to the bottom of alleged discord between his bartender and kitchen staff.

10.title: Menu Mayhem
10.plot: The owner of "Zio Cecio", an Italian restaurant in Dallas, wants to get to the bottom of rumors about Tex-Mex food being served out of his establishment, but without his consent. A few employees are running a side business.

11.title: Boss Hog
11.plot: The owner of "Strokers Ice House", a biker bar and grill in Dallas, calls in Charles and the crew to investigate a dip in revenue, which may be related to a motorcycle shop.

12.title: Armed Services
12.plot: Keith hears complaints that his ex-military manager is being too strict.

13.title: Cooking the Books
13.plot: Charles and his team are in California to help the owners of "Sisley Italian Kitchen" get to the bottom of a revenue discrepancy that may or may not involve their bookkeeper.

1.title: Chef's Choice
1.plot: In the Season 4 opener, the owner of "Buster's Beach House" in Long Beach wants Charles to investigate claims that his executive chef is showing preferential treatment to the wait-staff, but that turns out not to be the only problem the restaurant faces.

2.title: Strange Brew
2.plot: Charles Stiles find more than one problem brewing at "Newport Beach Brewing Company" in California.

3.title: Employee of the Month
3.plot: The family-owned "Columbo's Italian Steakhouse" in Eagle Rock, Cal., is suffering from a lack of harmony among staff members due, in part, to a cutthroat Employee of the Month competition.

4.title: While the Cat's Away
4.plot: Suspicions that the staff of "Gauchos Village" in Glendale, Cal., took advantage of the fact that their boss was away recovering from a near-fatal accident are investigated by Charles and the team, who look into revenue discrepancies.

5.title: Too Many Cooks
5.plot: After complaints about the new executive chef at "Bistro Bordeaux" in Evanston, Illinois, Charles Stiles discovers that the problem is he's being sabotaged by other staff members.

6.title: Wine on Wheels
6.plot: The owner of "Big and Little's Restaurant", a Chicago BYOB eatery, contacts Charles Stiles to investigate rumors that some of his employees are illegally selling alcohol to customers.

7.title: Lactose Intolerant
7.plot: The owner of "Cheesie's Pub and Grub" in Chicago is suspicious after several petite women easily complete an eating challenge, so he asks Charles and the team to investigate whether employees are bending the rules for certain customers.

8.title: Deliver Us from Evil
8.plot: Charles Stiles helps the owner of Bella Luna Café, in Chicago, uncover problems with its delivery service, after the owner receive numerous complaints from customers, who were being mistreated.

9.title: Mommy Dearest
9.plot: The owner of "Gigi Restaurant" in Philadelphia asks Mystery Diners to investigate possible discrimination, from his mother/manager of Gigi, to young customers.

10.title: Security Issues
10.plot: Charles Stiles and his team are called to Philadelphia, after rumors of a night security guard being too rough with customers at Del Rossi's Cheesesteak Co.

11.title: What a Drag
11.plot: A member of the team goes undercover, as a drag queen, to investigate whether a weekly trivia competition is rigged, which is what the cross-dressing customers of Philadelphia's "Venture Inn" have suggested to the concerned owner.

12.title: Three's a Crowd
12.plot: Marvin, the owner of Falls Taproom in Philadelphia, contacts Charles to help investigate an ongoing feud between his girlfriend/manager and best friend/customer.

13.title: Secret Sauce
13.plot: The owner of a Texas restaurant chain, called "Cooper's Old Time Pit Bar-B-Que, suspects that one of his employees has divulged a secret family recipe to a rival business.

1.title: Tastes Like Chicken
1.plot: After hearing rumors that customers are being served meat at his vegan restaurant, Mitch, owner of San Francisco's "Source", contacts Charles Stiles for help. Mystery Diners go undercover and discover what's really prepared in the kitchen.

2.title: Fired Up
2.plot: Fearing his staff is pranking customers with the restaurant's mouth-burning "Devil"s XXX" hot sauce, Ken Looney, owner of "Looney's Southern BBQ" in San Leandro, Cal., asks Charles Stiles to investigate. Mystery Diners goes undercover.

3.title: Money on the Side
3.plot: When Don, owner of Rocco's Cafe in San Francisco hears rumors that his manager is running unauthorized promotions, he contacts Charles Stiles to investigate. Mystery Diners show Don how his restaurant is really being run.

4.title: Pardon My French
4.plot: Philippe, owner of Chapeau! in San Francisco, contacts Charles Stiles to investigate complaints that his wait staff is rude with customers. Mystery Diners Kiel and Brianna go undercover and discover an even bigger problem.

5.title: Oktobertheft
5.plot: Cindy, co-owner of "Speisekammer" in Alameda, California, fears that the German "Dirndl Girls" hired by her ex-husband are causing more harm than good. She contacts Charles Stiles to find out.

6.title: Grapes of Wrath
6.plot: After noticing that several bottles of expensive wine missing, Michael, owner of Bistro Baffi, in Burien, WA, contacts Charles Stiles for help. Mystery Diners go undercover to discover a staff member's taking more than a paycheck.

7.title: Greek Tragedy
7.plot: Often finding broken dishes, Nader, who owns "My Greek and Italian Restaurant" in Tacoma, Wash., contacts Charles Stiles to investigate. Mystery Diners go undercover and discover a staff member's getting carried away with Greek tradition.

8.title: The Great Divide
8.plot: After inheriting staff from the previous owner, the new owners of Sam's Tavern, in Seattle, believe there's a divide between the old and new employees. Charles Stiles sends in Nadine and Jason to discover who's responsible for the rift.

9.title: Mascot Mayhem
9.plot: Rumors of a misbehaving restaurant mascot are investigated when Charles and his team visit "Zippy's Giant Burgers" in Seattle.

10.title: Paranormal Activities
10.plot: When Demetri, owner of Taverna Mazi in Seattle, hears rumors that customers are taking "haunted tours" of his restaurant, he contacts Charles Stiles to investigate.

11.title: Coupon Coup
11.plot: After noticing an unusual increase in coupons, Aaron, owner of The Hangout, calls Charles Stiles to investigate. Mystery Diners Shelby and Kiel go undercover to discover the wait staff's taking advantage of their situation.

12.title: Cover Charge
12.plot: The owners of Redballs Rock and Roll Pizza, David and Petra, hire Charles to investigate missing pizza supplies at the Moorpark, CA restaurant. Mystery Diner Grant plays a customer and his colleague Amber plays a waitress as they investigate what's happening at the restaurant. Musician and former child star Robbie Rist aids the investigation.

13.title: Dinner Drama
13.plot: The owner of "Encore Dinner Theatre" in Tustin, California, calls in Charles and his team to investigate if a relationship involving a waiter and an actress is creating drama and negatively affecting customer service.

1.title: Mexicali Blues
1.plot: The owners of a Mexican restaurant in Los Angeles are concerned that their customers are being served items that aren't on the menu.

2.title: Trimming the Fat
2.plot: A decrease in valuable fat trimmings is investigated by the team when they go undercover at Spring Street Smoke House in Los Angeles.

3.title: Food Truck Fiasco
3.plot: The owner of a lobster food truck in Los Angeles has reason to believe that his new drivers are using his vehicle for personal errands.

4.title: Charitable Donations
4.plot: The owner of "Pelons Tex Mex" in Austin, Texas has the team investigate rumors that his staff is collecting money for an unauthorized charity.

5.title: Bad Poets Society
5.plot: The owners of "Old School Bar and Grill" in Austin, Texas have concerns over a loss of revenue when they hold poetry nights.

6.title: Family Ties
6.plot: The team look into a feud that's affecting business at Austin's "Bakehouse Restaurant and Bar".

7.title: Fraternal Disorder
7.plot: The owner of "Uncle Billy's Brew and Que" in Austin has the team investigate rumors that kegs of his beer are being purchased, without his permission, for consumption at local frat parties.

8.title: Raw Deal
8.plot: While investigating whether employees of "Beets Café" in Austin, Texas are selling the owner's raw food recipes, Charles and his team uncover an even bigger problem.

9.title: Scorpion Sting
9.plot: An employee's gambling addiction is uncovered by the team during an investigation into a discrepancy involving the expensive scorpions used in a shot served at "Nacho Daddy" in Las Vegas.

10.title: Life's Not a Beach
10.plot: When Marty, owner of Barefoot Bob's Beach Bar and Gaming in Las Vegas, hears employee complaints about his new manager, he asks Charles Stiles to investigate. Mystery Diners go undercover to find the source of the problem.

11.title: Magic Hassle
11.plot: The owner of "Sergio's Italian Gardens" in Las Vegas hires Charles and the team to get to the bottom of a conflict between her longtime pianist and a recently hired magician.

12.title: Heavy Lifting
12.plot: The owners of a health food restaurant in Las Vegas are concerned about discrepancies with their supply of expensive protein supplements.

13.title: The Italian Job
13.plot: The owner of "Metro Pizza" in Las Vegas needs helps settling a feud between his pizzeria and bakery.

1.title: Going to the Dogs
1.plot: Charles helps the co-owners of "Shades Oceanfront Bistro" in San Diego, which caters to both human and canine customers, get to the bottom of a discrepancy in their chicken and beef supply.

2.title: Cocktail Fail
2.plot: A tense rivalry between two flair bartenders and missing alcohol are among the problems investigated by Charles and the team, when they arrive at the "Compass" in Carlsbad, California.

3.title: Promotion Sabotage
3.plot: When Isabel and Todd, owners of Barrio Star in San Diego have a dispute over which waiter to promote to manager, they contact Charles Stiles to mediate. Mystery Diners discover one of the candidates is being sabotaged from within.

4.title: Dueling Food Trucks
4.plot: Owners of rival food trucks work together to investigate revenue loss in both of their vehicles.

5.title: Trademark Trouble
5.plot: A San Diego restaurant owner fears that someone within his organization is trying to steal his signature sandwich.

6.title: Customer Concerns
6.plot: The owner of "730 South" in Denver, worries that his regular customers are guilty of acting entitled and asks Charles and the team to get to the bottom of the problem, which their investigation reveals is being caused by a certain employee.

7.title: Heavy Metal Mess
7.plot: The owners of the "Toad Tavern" in Littleton, Colorado, are concerned that their son and his band mates are too focused on getting their music careers off the ground and are letting their responsibilities at the restaurant slide.

8.title: Vicious Cycle
8.plot: A bicycle delivery service is investigated by Charles and the team, after the owner of "Sliceworks" in Denver notices a decrease in sales and an increase in complaints.

9.title: Secret Pairings
9.plot: Food costs are a concern for the owners of "Indulge Bistro and Wine Bar" in Colorado, who, after contacting Charles and the team, discover that some of their employees are hosting their own secret pairing events.

10.title: Vintage Scams
10.plot: A dip in sales at "Rock-a-Billies" in Arvada, Colorado, is investigated by Charles and the team, who discover the restaurant staff is breaking multiple rules.

11.title: Partner in Crime
11.plot: The owner of the "Black Rose Tavern" in Los Angeles is worried that someone is taking advantage of her, but needs Charles and the team to figure out who.

12.title: Cafe Coup
12.plot: The new owners of "Café Aldente" in Studio City, California, worry that the staff they inherited are still practicing old policies, and so they ask Charles and his team to observe their employees in action.

13.title: Daddy's Girl
13.plot: The owners of "Geppino's Sicilian Kitchen" in Moorpark, Cal., suspect that their daughter is dating a thief, after their customers start complaining about stolen items.

1.title: Employee Discount
1.plot: The owner of a wine shop and a restaurant in Los Angeles discovers discrepancies at both his businesses and believes they are related.

2.title: Poaching Profits
2.plot: The owner of "Cookin' with Lenny Smokehouse" in Los Angeles contacts Charles to investigate his suspicion that a member of his staff is using restaurant supplies to operate a competing catering company.

3.title: Missing Memorabilia
3.plot: The owners of "Fenders Moto Café and Brew Pub" in Portland, Oregon, worry that employees are to blame when some of their valuable motorcycle memorabilia disappears.

4.title: Robbed Kabobs
4.plot: The owners of "Dar Salam" in Portland, Oregon, ask Charles and his team to look into a discrepancy in supplies, which they worry is related to a new Iraqi food cart that's competing with their restaurant.

5.title: Behind the Eight Ball
5.plot: Kent, owner of Uptown Billiards in Portland, OR, believes the social media expert he hired to promote his restaurant isn't doing an adequate job. Charles sends in Mystery Diner Amber and discovers the customers are being hustled.

6.title: Thanksgiving Thievery
6.plot: The owner of a tavern, outside of Los Angeles, is suspicious that his employees are stealing donations from his restaurant's annual Thanksgiving food drive.

7.title: Food Cart Catastrophe
7.plot: Grievances against the new on-site manager of a food cart pavilion in Portland, Oregon, are investigated by Charles and his team.

8.title: Local Celebrities
8.plot: Charles is asked to check up on the staff at "Amalfi's" in Portland, Oregon, because the owners are worried that they are getting too carried away with the digital shorts they produce to promote the restaurant.

9.title: Memorabilia Mayhem
9.plot: A dip in memorabilia sales at the "Rock Island Café" in Honolulu worries the owner, who contacts Charles to investigate whether his staff is to blame.

10.title: Deep Sea Delivery
10.plot: The owner of "Cha Cha Cha Salsaria" in Honolulu asks Charles to investigate rumors of an unauthorized boat delivery service.

11.title: Hawaiian Club Crashers
11.plot: Charles and the team go undercover at the "Hawaiian Yacht Club" in Honolulu to get to the bottom of complaints about non-members being given access to exclusive dinner events.

12.title: Fyre on the Beach
12.plot: Discrepancies in sales are investigated by Charles and the team, when they go undercover at "Shore Frye" in Honolulu.

13.title: Bad Credit
13.plot: Multiple ticket voids lead the owner of "Chef Chai", in Honolulu, to contact Charles and his team to investigate whether his staff is making honest mistakes or trying to pull a fast one.

1.title: Bowling for Dollars
1.plot: In the Season 9 premiere, the owner of "Corbin Bowl" in Tarzana, Cal., contacts Charles for help after hearing complaints about rowdy customers. An investigation reveals that employees are condoning reckless behavior.

2.title: Deli Drama
2.plot: Charles and his team investigate "Lenny's Deli" in Los Angeles, after the owner expresses concerns that his new baker is taking artistic license with customer cake orders. However, bigger problems are discovered hurting this business.

3.title: Very Bad Bosses
3.plot: A waitstaff in California contact Charles to do a reverse sting on their employer, in order to bring their alleged mistreatment to light.

4.title: Barrel of Monkeys
4.plot: Missing wine barrels are investigated by Charles and his team, during a visit to "Doffo Winery" in Temecula, California.

5.title: Red Hot Mess
5.plot: The owners of "Hot Red Bus", a British-style restaurant near Los Angeles, contact Charles after hearing rumors that their business is open on the day it's supposed to be closed.

6.title: Private Chef Sting
6.plot: Charles has a repeat customer when the owner of "Capo's Speakeasy" in Las Vegas, who the team helped in the past, requests a sting operation on his personal chef.

7.title: Mystery Wedding
7.plot: Theft is a concern for the owners of "MovieSets", a prop house-turned-event center in New Orleans, and so Charles investigates, by sending in two members of his team, posed as an engaged couple who are interested in booking a wedding reception.

8.title: Repeat Offender
8.plot: The undercover team discover that a problem employee, previously busted by Charles, is now working for a New Orleans restaurateur, who is concerned about an unhealthy competition between two of her businesses.

9.title: Too Many Tourists
9.plot: The owner of "Marigny Brasserie" in New OrIeans isn't happy about the influx of rowdy tourists at his "locals bar", and so he contacts Charles and his team to investigate the situation.

10.title: The Spoils of Victory
10.plot: A bigger problem is exposed after the owner of "Victory", in New Orleans, contacts Charles to investigate rumors that his restaurant's signature cocktail is being served at other nearby bars.

11.title: Cabin Fever
11.plot: Charles and the team travel to the "Gateway Restaurant and Lodge" in Three Rivers, Cal., to determine who among the staff is throwing unauthorized parties in vacant cabins.

12.title: Train Robbery
12.plot: Missing supplies and unauthorized passengers are a concern for the owner of the "Fillmore and Western Railway" in California.

13.title: Dusting for Prints
13.plot: The owner of "Fuzion" in Huntington Beach, Cal., suspects a manager has stolen more than $4000 from her restaurant's safe, which leads to an undercover operation to collect fingerprint samples from all of the possible culprits.

1.title: Partner Problems
1.plot: Season 10 begins with a former client contacting Charles, for help, determining if he should invest in a failing California restaurant. During the team's sting operation, they discover that the current owner isn't being honest about all of his problems.

2.title: Art Show Sting
2.plot: After noticing numerous discrepancies with the catering company she uses to cater her art shows, Patricia contacts Mystery Diners for help. Charles sends in Jamie and Brianna and discovers an even bigger problem with the assistant curator.

3.title: Young Blood
3.plot: Charles and his team investigate when the owner of "Harvey's Steakhouse" in Huntington Beach, California, notices a dip in older customers, leading to a discovery of unauthorized events being held by the staff to draw in a younger crowd.

4.title: Backdoor Bootlegging
4.plot: Charles and his team uncover a large-scale bootlegging operation at "Weiland Brewery" in Los Angeles.

5.title: Extracurricular Activities
5.plot: A Florida cooking academy is investigated, because the owners are worried that their instructors are going off curriculum.

6.title: Hamburger Burglar
6.plot: The owners of "Latin House" in Miami worry that someone, at their off-site warehouse, is giving away the recipes to their award-winning burgers.

7.title: Unhappy Hour
7.plot: The owner of a Miami Beach hotel asks Charles and the team to investigate whether his staff are sneaking their friends into a free happy hour he offers to guests.

8.title: Missing Links
8.plot: The manager of a golf course in Hollywood, Florida, asks the team to investigate complaints about non-members playing for free. However, a bigger problem is discovered in the club's dining room.

9.title: History Mystery
9.plot: The owner of "Old Vinings Inn", a historical restaurant in Atlanta, asks Charles and the team to investigate whether Civil War tours are taking place, without his permission.

10.title: Red Ink
10.plot: A drop in food and tattoo sales at the "Anchor Bar and Tattoo" in Atlanta is investigated by Charles and the team.

11.title: Tour Bust
11.plot: The father-son owners of "Star Café" and "Star Coaches" in Atlanta, worry about missing food in their kitchen and a rise in fuel expenses on their tour buses.

12.title: Skating on Thin Ice
12.plot: After noticing missing food and merchandise, the owners of "Epic Rollertainment" in Murrieta, California, contact Charles Stiles for help. Upon investigation, the team discover an ever bigger problem, when the roller rink closes at night.

13.title: Drive-Thru Drama
13.plot: A drop in customers seems suspicious to the owner of "B'Man Teriyaki and Burgers" in Pasadena, California, prompting him to call in Charles Stiles and his team, who uncover a problem with the drive-thru staff, when Season 10 concludes.

1.title: Street Vendor Violation
1.plot: Lackluster dinner sales and a dip in bottle service concern the owners of "Supperclub" in Los Angeles, who, after contacting Charles and his team for help, become aware that some of their staff are using a street vendor to line their pockets.

2.title: From Russia Without Love
2.plot: An elaborate con is uncovered, when Charles and his team investigate a Russian chef, on behalf of an aspiring restaurateur, who's thinking about becoming his business partner.

3.title: Steals on Wheels
3.plot: The owner of a meal-delivery service wants Charles to investigate several complaints from customers, which leads to the discovery of a big problem inside her kitchen.

4.title: Secondhand Scam
4.plot: A seller of kitchen supplies asks Charles Stiles for help, after his customers find food inside the factory-sealed appliances they just purchased, which leads to the discovery of a large-scale scam operation.

5.title: Unhappy Holidays
5.plot: A decline in sales every holiday season is investigated by Charles and the team, during an undercover operation at "Smokin' Barrel" in Hoboken, New Jersey, which turns up a suspicious sidewalk solicitor.

6.title: Comic Book Caper
6.plot: The owner of a comic book-themed restaurant in Brooklyn discovers an employee is using their powers for evil.

7.title: Vicious Valets
7.plot: Complaints about a Brooklyn restaurant's valet service prompt an undercover investigation, during which an unauthorized car wash is discovered.

8.title: Venue Vandals
8.plot: The owner of the "Spanish Potato Grill" in Brick, N.J., reaches out to Charles Stiles and the team for help investigating possible vandalism at his new restaurant location, which is currently under construction.

9.title: Lobster Looting
9.plot: The brother-sister owners of "Langosta Lounge" in Ashbury Park, New Jersey, contact Charles Stiles after noticing a discrepancy in their lobster supply.

10.title: Tables Turned
10.plot: Charles and his undercover team conduct a sting, from inside a restaurant, to see if horrifying accusations against a boss are true.

11.title: Hot Meat
11.plot: Deals, that are too good to be true, lead the owner of Rivoli's in Toms River, New Jersey, to believe that his new meat purveyor is selling him stolen goods.

13.title: Rigged Rental
13.plot: Charles and his team investigate whether the owner of "Nashville Street Tacos" is right to worry that his part-time apartment, above his restaurant, is being used while he's out of town.

14.title: Crooked Contest
14.plot: After hearing rumors that their songwriting contest is rigged, Rose and Tom of Belcourt Taps in Nashville contact Charles Stiles for help. '80s pop star Tiffany goes undercover as a Mystery Diner to investigate.

12.title: Venue Vandals
12.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.plot outline: Restaurant owners call a company, called "mystery diners", when/if they are suspicious about their employees. Sometimes they steal or treat customers badly etc... The company will set up surveillance cameras and use actors to help find evidence that the employees are doing these things, sometimes leading to them getting suspended, fired or sued.
imdb.title: Mystery Diners
plot: Restaurant owners call a company, called "mystery diners", when/if they are suspicious about their employees. Sometimes they steal or treat customers badly etc... The company will set up surveillance cameras and use actors to help find evidence that the employees are doing these things, sometimes leading to them getting suspended, fired or sued.
